title: Adnoc expands Zakum offshore drilling fleet, output boost from 2026
keypoints: Adnoc is set to boost production from the giant offshore Zakum field with further ramp-up from 2026.
The expansion includes awarding a $412m drilling contract for Upper Zakum.
Adnoc Logistics and Services has been awarded its first major contract for a new Lower Zakum island.
Adnoc is increasing the volumes of medium sour Upper Zakum crude to its Ruwais refining complex.

title: Quick Resolution Of IOCs Divestment Will Boost Crude Oil Production, Independent Producers Tells FG
keypoints: The IPPG chairman calls for expedited resolution of IOC divestments to unlock crude oil production up to 2.5 million barrels per day.
Approval of IOC divestment is seen as a way to restore global investor confidence in Nigeria.
Despite Nigeria's large hydrocarbon resources, current production is significantly below capacity.
Advocates for deepwater development to unlock incremental production of 700,000 barrels per day.
Emphasizes the need for domestic refining and petrochemical capacity to transform Nigeria into a net exporter.

title: OPEC: Global crude oil demand will rise to 116m bpd in 2045
keypoints: OPEC projects global oil demand to reach 116 million barrels per day by 2045.
World economy expected to grow from $138 trillion in 2023 to $270 trillion in 2045.
Total oil-related investment requirements between 2024 and 2045 estimated at $14 trillion.
OPEC emphasizes the need for significant investment to maintain supply security and avoid volatility.
675 million people currently lack access to basic energy forms; 2.3 billion without access to clean cooking fuels.

title: Dangote Refinery to source crude oil from other African countries after imports from US, Brazil
keypoints: Dangote Refinery plans to source crude oil from African countries like Angola, Senegal, and Libya.
Recent imports from the US and Brazil are expected to supply the refinery in the coming months.
Local refineries in Nigeria face challenges in securing crude due to preferences for export by IOCs.
Dangote Refinery aims to start production of petrol by mid-July and significantly reduce Nigeria's dependency on imported petroleum products.
Regulatory bodies insist IOCs meet local demand before exporting.
